Docs.summary: Allows Cosmos specific configuration to be performed on .

remarks.para:
Instances of this class are returned from a call to
and it is not designed to be directly constructed in your application code.
See Using DbContextOptions, and Accessing Azure Cosmos DB with EF Core for more information and examples.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.CosmosDbContextOptionsBuilder ContentResponseOnWriteEnabled (bool enabled = true);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.CosmosDbContextOptionsBuilder ContentResponseOnWriteEnabled(bool enabled) cil managed
Public Overridable Function ContentResponseOnWriteEnabled (Optional enabled As Boolean = true) As CosmosDbContextOptionsBuilder

abstract member ContentResponseOnWriteEnabled : bool -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.CosmosDbContextOptionsBuilder override this.ContentResponseOnWriteEnabled : bool -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.CosmosDbContextOptionsBuilder

Docs.summary: Sets the boolean to only return the headers and status code in the Cosmos DB response for write item operation like Create, Upsert, Patch and Replace. Setting the option to false will cause the response to have a null resource. This reduces networking and CPU load by not sending the resource back over the network and serializing it on the client.
Docs.remarks: See Using DbContextOptions, and Accessing Azure Cosmos DB with EF Core for more information and examples.

Docs.param: The number of requests allowed simultaneously over a single TCP connection.
Docs.summary: Configures the number of requests allowed simultaneously over a single TCP connection. When more requests are in flight simultaneously, the direct/TCP client will open additional connections.
Docs.remarks: See Using DbContextOptions, and Accessing Azure Cosmos DB with EF Core for more information and examples.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.CosmosDbContextOptionsBuilder MaxTcpConnectionsPerEndpoint (int connectionLimit);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.CosmosDbContextOptionsBuilder MaxTcpConnectionsPerEndpoint(int32 connectionLimit) cil managed
Public Overridable Function MaxTcpConnectionsPerEndpoint (connectionLimit As Integer) As CosmosDbContextOptionsBuilder

abstract member MaxTcpConnectionsPerEndpoint : int -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.CosmosDbContextOptionsBuilder override this.MaxTcpConnectionsPerEndpoint : int -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.CosmosDbContextOptionsBuilder

Docs.param: The maximum number of TCP connections that may be opened to each Cosmos DB back-end.
Docs.summary: Configures the maximum number of TCP connections that may be opened to each Cosmos DB back-end. Together with MaxRequestsPerTcpConnection, this setting limits the number of requests that are simultaneously sent to a single Cosmos DB back-end (MaxRequestsPerTcpConnection x MaxTcpConnectionPerEndpoint).
Docs.remarks: See Using DbContextOptions, and Accessing Azure Cosmos DB with EF Core for more information and examples.
